Her response was the store doesn’t have a number. I asked, so there is absolutely no way possible to communicate or get in touch with anyone at that location? And she said that’s correct. name: Carol Mccay
text: Bobby and Charles replaced our old leaky hall bathroom faucet.Installed new faucet very professional and courteous. Would recommend them if you need great plumbers.

name: Michael Jones
text:
Nice guys with the estimate. Made sense in their explanation. We had had several companies come by. Set a date. Called several times the morning of the appointment. Finally got a call back from the tech around 10.  Said he couldn’t get to it that day, too busy. Hopefully the next week. Called someone else. Came that day. Installed both new gas lines and regulators. Nice , clean,  professional and $350 less expensive.

I should point out that I cannot judge the quality of their work. All  other reviews indicate they are good at what they do. Their inability to not show without notice was the cause for my low review. We had family plans related to their work.

resp.text: We regret that we could not get to you last week on Thursday, the day you scheduled for, and that you elected to go with another company. That day all of our plumbers except for the one assigned to do the work at your home already had very time sensitive, pressing, all day jobs that were presceduled to get started on early in the morning. Although the plumber assigned to you was called out to an emergency job early that morning we still had every intention of having him still come out to install your regulators and the extra line for your home as planned for that day. It wasnt until the morning started to progress forward in time that he realized he would not be able to get to you as planned due to him still diligently working to restore water at an elderly lady's home where she called very early that morning and said she had been without water since the day before so we had him rush right over. It was around mid morning at the time that he realized he wouldn't be able to make it to you as planned and we had to make the decision to attempt to reschedule with you since her emergency took presidence. Each and every customer and each job is truly important to us, we care greatly about the work that we do, our customers and how we serve them. We take pride in striving daily for complete satisfaction with every customer so we are very sorry to hear about your dissatisfaction. Sometimes there are circumstances and emergency situations that arise out of our control to where we may not be able to stick to our schedule as planned. Normally in a situation like that we would have just had one of our other plumbers come out that day in his place but each of them on that specific day were already on very pressing jobs that would take all day. That was a rare occasion but again sometimes there are circumstances that arise out of control to where true emergencies take presidence. Under these circumstances I do not think a two star review is warranted in this situation considering we gave you a free estimate, you called us back a couple weeks later after getting multiple other estimates from other companies to schedule a day for us to do the work at your home and we were unfortunately not able to get to it that day due to the circumstances listed above so we attempted to reschedule. The attempt was denied which resulted in us not performing any work at your residence. Again, we are so sorry if you were inconvenienced, we would love to speak with you more about this matter. Please reach out to us at info@allstarplumbs.com

name: Evangeline Smith
text:
Called Home Advisors for plumber after debacle with local plumber Teds. AllStar gave me a price for installing pressure regular that was 1/2 Teds, 250.00. That went ok.
I then asked them to fix tub faucet leak. They replaced some parts, charged me 130.00 & the leak was dry for ONE DAY. When they returned after my call, they again took the mechanism apart, showed me a "bent part" .
I have no way of knowing if they bent it on the initial try, or if as they intemated, it was done by Teds. Then quoted me a price of an ADDITIONAL 350.00 to fix this leak. No offer to try & fix it without further charge since they didn't fix it the first time either! I declined.
I have now spent 605.00, and still have the tub faucet leak, &am still waiting for my "senior citizen discount". Don't be fooled. Home Advisor is not the answer.

resp.text:
We are very sorry to hear that you are not pleased with your experience. However, our recollection of events is a bit different. We initially arrived to install a pressure regulator at a rate that was half what you had been quoted by our competitors. We complete this work and you were seemingly satisfied! You then informed us that your nearly 60 year old shower faucet was leaking so we agreed to attempt to fix it as after you denied the price quoted  to replace it 350$. We replaced all parts that are available for your particular faucet. Then on an additional visit in an attempt to try our best to ensure complete customer satisfaction we proceeded to replace the same parts again for free (we purchased the new parts and did not charge any labor and did not charge you for the purchase of the parts) because we thought they may have been defective. It ended up being that it was not defective parts,  the leak was due to it being an almost 60 year old shower faucet.   Our total cost in parts at this point is over $60 however we still honored the original price quoted and informed you that the you needed a new faucet that we would purchase and replace the old one with for $350 . You responded that the next homeowner would have to deal with that issue. You paid and we were on our way. Since
you posted this review we have attempted to reach out to you multiple times and you have ignored us and tried to chargeback the entire 130$. We strive for complete customer satisfaction but sometimes we may fall short due to circumstances out of our control. However,  we attempted to contact you to no avail. Again we will still be glad to attempt to come to a resolution but communication is vital. We hope to hear back from you soon.

Stephanie in reception was so helpful at answering my questions and an absolute delight in an otherwise stressful situation. A problem we found with other companies is even though they say "24 hour service" they won't even answer the phone. These guys were on the ball though! name: Olivia Hardy
text: My husband went to the back to buy a blower unit for the inside part of our A/C. When he got there he found out that they don't sell them as a unit like they used to. You have to buy just the motor, so that's what he bought. When he gets it home, he finds out that it didn't have mount brackets so I went up there to get one that does. I was then told that none of the motors come with bracket mounts. I made the comment that he should have told my husband that so he could have gotten it while he was there. It's hot and this is our A/C unit we're trying to fix in the middle of a hot day. The gentleman said it wasn't his job to know what a person knew or not. I told him that he knew more than my husband on what parts come with what, that's when a woman came around counter and said that she was the owner and that I didn't need to talk to her employee that way. I wasn't being rude or belligerent. I just didn't think it would have been that hard to ask if the customer knew it didn't come with bracket mounts, especially if he brought an older model in. This will be the last time my family and I will be back to that store and before today, I would have recommended that store to anyone. Now I'll tell people to stay away. It's nothing like it used to be.

resp.text:
Mrs. Hardy,
You did not speak to the owner for I am the owner, and I was at another store that day, you spoke to a co-worker, but Mrs. Hardy we have no idea what a customer's needs are until they inform us.
There are hundreds of units, and they change models every year, and the servicemen have to request what they need from us. We are a supply house, not a service company, and we are sorry that your husband did not realize he need additional products, but that was his call and not ours. Your husband was servicing his own unit.
We try and make all customers happy, and were sorry that you were disappointed, but do realize we have no idea what is wrong with a central unit until a serviceman request a particular part.

text: 53 Hardware is the country feed and seed store I remember growing up out west.  The difference is that 53 Hardware seems to have brilliant insight into the average need of an average homeowner.  Nearly every time I decide to check 53 Hardware before "going to town", I am elated to find the thing I need - with options for price point and brand occasionally.  Truly, 53 HW saves me money and time.  Many home projects where I discover, elbow deep in it, I am missing one little fastener or that one piece to get done, 53 HW comes through.   Hey, they mix paint as well!  Good stuff to boot.  Recently they mixed a color for me that did not come out right. They took my number as they were closing.  The next day I received a call from the owner to let me know they figured it out and it was ready for pickup.  That kind of service with excellent price point and products is what you get from this store l.  Overall, 53 Hardware saves me a lot of time, frustration, and money.  That is well worth my short drive to 53 Hardware for that "one thing" at a good price, if not better than the big box.  If I know they have what I need, 53 Hardware is my primary place to shop for home DIY and other garden needs.  I highly recommend a trip to 53 Hardware for your DIY home and garden needs.

name: Kevin Cosma
text:
If you're a big company and want to do business with V & W, then you'll probably get treated right.

But, from my personal experience as an individual, they couldn't care less about you.
They did not have the part in stock, and they had no interest in trying to obtain it for me. (even though they said they order it if I couldn't get it anywhere else)

I've never been to a business that turns away a customer like this.

So, I can take a hint, I will not be back!

resp.text:
Hello Kevin,

We were very sorry to hear about your experience while visiting our business.

As a small locally owned and operated business, we work hard to be a part of the community and to be counted on.  We assure you we care very much about your plumbing needs.

Please contact me at the Birmingham location 205.324.9521, I would be happy to personally help you with the part you need.

- Lee Herritt, Owner

name: Dana Hamilton
text: Lauren Doss of V&W Supply Company was tremendously helpful to my husband and me recently when we remodeled both of our bathrooms.  V&W has a large selection of bathroom and kitchen fixtures, ranging in style from traditional to ultra-modern.  Lauren met with us and walked us through their large showroom,  demonstrating features of the various products, helping us to chose products that would fit our needs and budget.  After we had made our selections, she coordinated the delivery with our contractor, and the delivery arrived perfectly on schedule.  All of the products are high quality at an affordable price.  We highly recommend V&W Supply Company for bathroom and kitchen fixtures and plumbing needs.

resp.text: Dana thank you so much! We would love for you to post photos of your remodel! Call us if you need anything.

name: Bridget Smith
text: I stopped by to see a Kohler faucet in person, I was told I needed an appointment. The faucet I came to look at was literally 15 feet from me, the front desk guy chuckled when I asked if I could just look at that one faucet and be on my way, he shook his head while exaggerating a nooooooo. I would have called back and placed the order with their sales person but went a mile down the road to Southern Pipe & Supply and purchased the faucet. Work on your customer service.

resp.text:
Dear Ms. Smith,

First off we are sorry you experienced frustration while visiting our showroom.

Since March 25, 2020 for the safety of our customers and our employees we have enforced a strict policy regarding the National Pandemic we are experiencing.

Our policy states our showroom is open by appointment only and there are exactly 3 signage points before entering our showroom to explain this policy.

In reading our previous reviews you will see we provide not only a high quality product, but a fantastic customer experience.

We would like to encourage and invite you to make an appointment so you can experience this service for yourself.

Thank you for visiting our store.

text: Awful customer service. First of all, it took them forever to get the shipment for our order. When the plumber came to install everything there was a piece missing. I called about it on Friday and said they would call me back. They never did, so I had to call again on Monday. The lady who sold us the items (Dawn) was very curt, saying that she had put that piece in the box herself and she could order another one, but she would have to charge me for it. I did not appreciate the way she talked to me or the way she handled the situation. She made it sound like I was lying about the missing piece. I told her to not order another one, that I found it on amazon and would get it from there. Thank you very much (not). Never ordering from there again, especially from Dawn!

resp.text:
Ms. Foster, we were sorry to hear of your disappointment. As you can see from our many great reviews, customer satisfaction is one of our primary goals.

When you left your first message on Friday our customer service representative was off that day. She did return your call first thing Monday morning and when you told her that the escutcheon was missing from the order she did check and didn’t find that anything was left behind.

Dawn was very apologetic if she sounded curt with you and she did mention she called and left a message to apologize.

Dawn managed to find a replacement piece for you and your mother-in-law came and picked it up yesterday.

Once again we are sorry for the frustration, the miscommunication, and inconvenience this may have caused you.

Please do not hesitate to give us a call if there is anything else we can do for you (205) 324-9521.

name: JIll Billions
text:
Bought a replacement kitchen faucet here 5 years ago for nearly $500.00. After 3 years of use we began having problems with it. After another recent problem I decided to call V&W today about it. I spoke to a salesman ( Buck ? ) and asked if a faucet should last longer than that. His reply “ I don’t know. What do you want me to do about it ?”. I asked if these things usually have warranties or what. He was so rude and unhelpful. He did tell me the model number of my faucet so I could call the manufacturer- I asked if he could email it to me. He said “ no”. Well he didn’t ask me if I’d be buying any of my plumbing supplies there when we build our new home next year- because that answer would have been “ no “.
He finally just said “ call delta. Their number is 1-800- DELTA. Ha. He made it up. It’s not even enough characters. Won’t use anyplace that doesn’t help me politely with something I’ve bought there. The end.

text: This is a great store with excellent customer service. This particular faucet is not available online or lowe's/home depot. The store manager understood exactly what I wanted, ordered exactly what I wanted, walked me through the installation, and was incredibly knowledgable/helpful. He also took the time to help me troubleshoot a shutoff valve problem on another sink. Kohler makes a great product, the faucet is awesome, and this is the place to purchase. Great staff, local business, will definitely use again.

text:
I spent yesterday at Lowes and Home Depot without success trying to find a clean out plug for type schedule 40 PVC that I destroyed with my lawnmower.  I first tried Capital plumbing first; they did not carry the part, but recommended  Thompson...success!!!!

The people were very helpful and polite.  Looking around it seems as if they are very well stocked.  Thompson will definitely be my first stop for any plumbing needs I may have in the future.

FYI.  The original clean out plug had a square head on top to unscrew, the new one is flat, so I wont have to worry about hitting it with the lawnmower in the future.
